visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing distribution of Earth's water supply using percentage proportions with accessibility-enhanced tooltips

point.descriptionFormatter: function(point) { return point.name + ': ' + point.y + '% of total water supply'; }

visualization_explanation: The pie chart uses a trivariate categorical dataset representing Earth's three primary water reservoirs. Synthetic percentages (Salt:97%, Ice:2%, Fresh:1%) follow established hydrological data patterns from USGS sources. The 3:1 ratio between ice and fresh water reflects cryosphere distribution. Chart employs Tufte's data-ink maximization through clean white background and minimal plot borders. Cairo's color principles are applied using high-contrast, distinguishable hues (cyan-blue for saltwater, leaf-green for ice, orange for fresh water). Percentage formatting (+.0f precision) follows D3-style quantitative annotation. Time-agnostic proportions maintain statistical validity through fixed-sum percentage constraints (Σ=100%). Accessibility features include ARIA-compliant value suffixes and semantic color associations.
